moves.1. d4 Nf6: I decided to move my horse because it moves in an L shape and that is pretty cool.
moves.2. Bg5: I haven't ever seen anyone do this before.
moves.2... e6: But it's all coo' because my queen now has visual contact with the steed of awesomeness.
moves.3. e4: I see your game, you devious rogue you!
moves.3... Be7: That pin isn't cool yo. Not going to lose my Noble steed of awesomeness to some pawn like that.
moves.4. e5: Still going to advance. Long hair, don't care
moves.4... Nd5: Dun want my horsy to get taken.
moves.5. Bd2: That dude with the cross on his head ran away. Probably because my army is so intimidating and what not.
moves.5... d6: Quit cramping me yo, i need some room to breathe.
moves.6. c3: Waste of a tempo and removes a good square for one of his horsy.
moves.6... dxe5: HIYAHHHHH! And with the swiftness of a thousand lambs my pawn strikes!
moves.7. dxe5: I drew first blood, so its all good.
moves.7... Nc6: Now i have 2 horsy's running around. I wish i had an apple to feed them.
moves.8. Nf3: One of his horsy's come to protect the evil foot soldier dude that is in my space.
moves.8... O-O: My king decides it is time to chill in his awesome castle. It has a pool table.
moves.9. Bb5: That other dude with the cross on his head came out. Long hair, she don't care.
moves.9... Bd7: So i figure i will bring my other dude with the cross on his head. His name is Fredrick the 3rd and 1/2.
moves.10... Bxc6: VENGEANCE! dang poachers are stealing my steeds. Luckily Fredrick the 3rd and 1/2 was there to rectify the situation and maintain order.
moves.11. O-O: He goes into his castle. It probably doesn't have a pool table though.
moves.11... Nb6: My horsey made another L. It was pretty cool.
moves.12. Qc2: The evil succubus is on the move! You shan't have my king succubus!
moves.12... Bxf3: I decide to exchange my crossheaded dude for one of his horsey's, thus piercing his castle!
moves.13. gxf3: Now that i see inside his castle, i am certain there is no pool table.
moves.13... Nc4: My horsey threatens his cross headed guy.
moves.14. Bf4: But his cross headed guy runs away... again. What a pansy.
moves.14... Bg5: However, my cross headed guy is not a pansy, and looks to do battle.
moves.15. Bg3: And his cross headed guy runs away again! pansy...
moves.15... Bh4: My guy will not be denied!
moves.16... Bxg3: Hiyahhhh! and the cowardly cross headed dude is slain.
moves.17. hxg3: and now no crosses remain. And his castle still has a hole in it... Whats up with that?
moves.17... Nxe5: Yo... my horsey just ate a man. that is what happens when you don't feed them apples.
moves.18. Nd2: His horsey finally enters into the field. About time you lazy horse. Maybe he had too many apples?
moves.18... Qf6: And my noble lady leaps into the field!
moves.19... Ng4: Your castle is all but destroyed! your walls are crumbling and my army approaches!
moves.20. Nf3: His horsey comes to the defense...
moves.20... e5: But my minions know no fear! and i'm pretty sure there are apples on the other side of the board.
moves.21... exf4: Invading the castle for all the apples and other assorted fruits for my horsey.
moves.22... Qxf4: Your castle is all but destroyed, your apples will soon belong to me!
moves.23. Rfh1: A pathetic attempt to raid my castle! The pool table shall remain in my possession.
moves.23... h6: Your feeble assault has been repelled! My bulwark of fortitude is unrivaled!
moves.24. Rh4: I'm not worried. Your apples will soon belong to me.
moves.24... g5: And my castle suddenly grows feet and charges into the fray! Soon i shall send everything at your crumbling structure. Except for the pool table of course... That stays with me.
moves.25. Nxg5: A last ditch effort to create an opening for my pool table.
moves.25... Qxg5: However your assault is easily repelled once more.
moves.26. Rh3: Retreat you little pansy! Your apples will soon belong to me.
moves.26... Ne3+: And my noble steed makes his move on the evil succubus, whilst my noble lady discovers the king and his apples.
moves.27. Kf3: The castle has been fully vacated, and the apples are ripe for the taking!
moves.27... Nxc2: But first the steed defeats the evil succubus in battle.
moves.28. Rg3: Hmm... the noble lady is put in a predicament. However, the battle is all but over, and the apples will soon be mine.
moves.28... Qxg3+: And this is where my opponent cancels the game? He didn't leave, he didn't resign, but cancelled on the count of a move taking too long? Personally i'm a bit upset with that as i didn't think any of my moves were particularly long, however i have an apple, so i'm still calling it a victory and dominant performance. My pool table was not even threatened in the process either.
